meanings.definition: A shallow, flat-bottomed container for serving food.
meanings.sent1: The waiter carried the dished filled with soup to the table.
meanings.sent2: The kitchen had many clean dished ready for the dinner rush.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to balance on the dished left on the counter.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight reflected off the dished stacked in the cupboard.
meanings.sent5: The child dropped the dished, causing a loud clatter.

meanings.definition: To have a particular shape or quality, especially a concave or hollow one.
meanings.sent1: The bowl dished inward at the center.
meanings.sent2: The road dished slightly, causing rainwater to collect in the middle.
meanings.sent3: The artist dished the clay into a beautiful vase.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes dished with surprise when she saw the surprise party.
meanings.sent5: The valley dished between the mountains, creating a natural bowl shape.

meanings.sent1: The chef dished out generous portions of pasta.
meanings.sent2: She dished the salad onto the plates for the guests.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully dished out ice cream for dessert.
meanings.sent4: The cafeteria worker dished the hot soup carefully to avoid spills.
meanings.sent5: He dished the stew onto the dished, making sure each one had enough meat.

meanings.sent1: The neighbors dished about the new family moving in next door.
meanings.sent2: She dished out juicy details about the celebrity scandal.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends dished over coffee about the latest drama at school.
meanings.sent4: The tabloid magazine dished on the latest Hollywood gossip.
meanings.sent5: The office workers dished during their lunch break, sharing office rumors.
